benchmark_details.name: Problem-Oriented Code Optimization
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark introduces a problem-oriented perspective for code optimization, significantly enhancing the optimization capabilities of large language models (LLMs) by integrating diverse ideas from multiple programmers tackling the same problem.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve code optimization performance by utilizing a problem-oriented perspective.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The focus is solely on time efficiency optimization without considering other optimization directions.

data.source: Optimized and unoptimized code pairs derived from programming competition submissions.
data.annotation: Manual verification of optimization pairs for correctness.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance improvements of LLMs on the optimization pairs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher optimization ratios and speedups indicate better optimization performance.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures involve testing the benchmark using established coding competitions and checking for performance improvements.
